Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: rluvsheep
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Americana over Labor Day weekend. In total we had 3 different rooms on 2 floors. I'll start out by saying this is an older hotel. The wall paper is peeling in some places. The elevator is crazy slow and I had to go to the lobby twice to get towels becasue they werent finished doing laundry when they cleaned our room. Those are the worst things I can say about this hotel. It is on the boardwalk. I paid $427 total for a 3 day holiday weekend. The staff was very freindly and accomodating. We had a balcony with a side view, which was a great view. If that is important I would suggest requesting a room on floor 4 or 5. If you get a lower room on the one side you might be looking at the building next door. Our room was cleaned every day. Overall it was a good experience. I would definately reccommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't cancel!”
Reviews.Author: smgraci89
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous to stay at the Americana after reading the reviews, but my stay was JUST FINE. I feel the need to put a good review on here to help the place out! For the VERY cheap price, the few bumps along the road are completely worth it! Let me first say that as a 23 year old female, I'm a little picky and easily grossed out by dirty rooms - this place had no effect on me. It was clean, spacious, and lets be honest.. I didn't expect to spend much time in the room anyway! I only have 2 things to complain about after a week long stay; 1. The door to the back patio was difficult to open, and difficult to close/lock. 2. All of the stairway doors had a sign that said "Emergency Exit Only - Alarm Will Sound If Opened" so we were forced to take the elevators. However, there may have been an alternative had I asked the front desk. Thats it! So, if you're thinking about cancelling and you expect to spend 90% if your vaca in the room, maybe you want somewhere with a flat screen and free WIFI. But if you're just looking for a cheap, clean place to lay your head after a day on the beach and a night on the boardwalk, STAY HERE! :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Gr8tApostle
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled from NJ to Ocean City,MD for our annual vacation. I read the previous reviews and I must admit I was very nervous. But to my great surprise the Americana was great, clean, peaceful etc. I honestly do not have one complaint. Great family enviorment for a great price!! I recommend the Americana.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes it's good to ignore reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Zee497
Reviews.Content: I was told about this hotel through a friend of my fiance and i have to say after reading the reviews I was going to cancel, but after deciding to try the place out, I'm glad we didnt. The place was great, the rooms were nice and clean and the view from my room spectacular, and the staff was very nice, not to mention the price we paid to be right on the broadwalk was a steal, the only complaint I have is that you need a strong man to open the balcony door and the water pressure was low. Other than that, this is a place I'd recommend to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the advice, just cancelled.”
Reviews.Author: ups643
Reviews.Content: Upon reviewing the very detailed reviews on Tripadvisor and calling the hotel to speak with a manager to no avail (no manager on duty), we have decided to cancel not 1 but 5 rooms for the upcoming weekend. Maybe the Americana should pay heed to the criticism on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 91loulou
Reviews.Content: We checked in 2different rooms on Monday. The first room the sink was clogged, toilet would not flush, and the ac didn't work. 2nd room the phone and ac would not work. A member if both of our families advised of the problems and was told it would be fixed. Someone also tried breaking in by removing the lock on the first rooms door (they never fixed lock after that incident). It got so hot in the rooms we has to leave the balcony doors open. Upon checking out we asked how they would make up for our horrible stay and they didn't care justvsaid they would have the maintenance man fix the problems. DO NOT WASTE your money to stay at this nasty nasty place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unfortunate Experience”
Reviews.Author: User1252970
Reviews.Content: Like all the other reviews say, the hotel was dirty, and poorly upkept. Broken glass in the creaking and slow elevator started the experience. Then we noticed the wallpaper tearing off in the room and hallways. Don't expect to use your key card more than 4 times without having to walk down to the main office and get it "recharged" again. We had to do that 3 times over a 2 day stay. Finally, besides having to run the water for 5 minutes before it is hot enough to take a shower, the huge box television needs an upgrade. Even though the screen was blurry, we still had to call and wait an hour for maintenance to come and fix it after a "lightning storm" shut it down to where it wouldn't turn back on. Overall, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, super hospitality”
Reviews.Author: skipamy
Reviews.Content: We had an unusual time ending up at the Americana. We were originally scheduled to stay at the Royalton hotel, but couldn't stomach it (see my review for that rat hole). So we went walking looking for somewhere to go. The Americana didn't have any rooms available for Saturday evening, but right away provided us with the names of other hotels that we could call. The manager, Sal, overheard our conversation with his staff, and immediately started calling several hotels for us, even trying the chamber of commerce to try to help us out. We ended up bunking in my brother in laws room for the night and checking into the Americana the next day. We paid $189 + tax for an ocean front balcony room. Now, the wallpaper was starting to peel at the seams in some places, and the sliding door to the balcony was a little rough to deal with. However, we paid a decent price, got a clean room (no mold, not afraid to go barefoot in the room or shower, had a microwave, cold AC, cold fridge, clean sheets, no smoke or pee smells, no disgusting stains). If you need a 5 star hotel, this isn't for you, but if you need clean, decent, good rates and super kind service this is your place. We will be back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy L
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there July23rd-25th and It was a MORE then what I expected for my money.Everyone was very nice to us and we had NO problems at all.The room was very clean and the room was large. Not to mention your right on the boardwalk. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel out dated”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: My family and i went there for the 4th of July 2012 week and for the price that my husband paid we were better off at the Holiday Inn. I should of read all the reviews before we called them. The rooms were nasty, first let me start with the dark dirty carpet, once you close the curtain you can see holes every where. The beds yeah i read one of their responses and they said they have serta mattress yeah ok from the good will. The pillows even worst i had to ask for additional pillows. I check the sheets and it had a yellow stain. Like for real you guys keep saying we clean our hotels and we have good house keepers. The only good positive thing we got clean towels but the towels felt like the ones from the dollar store. The TV omg not even a flat screen so outdated. The walls please fix them you may get some business there however if you update your hotel i am telling you, your revenue will grow. Last but not least the AC attach to the wall displace the vents were dirty and the little tiny fridge omg defrost them before someone else checks in. The WIFI is a joke the guy keep telling me in the lobby i am log in and i was like yeah we are in the lobby i am in the first floor and couldn't log in. My recommendations get better sheets and covers, better pillows update the walls, clean your rooms better and change that dirty curtain. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE. Easy access to the beach however not a good place to sleep at.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley21502
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have stayed here several times. Yes there are so areas that need improved, like any hotel, but the price and the location beat all of the negatives. Its a little dated in the inside and needs a littlle TLC, but if you're looking for perfect, go spend $300-5003 per night for the Hilton! I will continue to stay each and every year, including a week in August this year!

Reviews.Title: “ok, but needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: CAR0CHA
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 other families over the Canada's day weekend. The hotel is fairly clean but old. no air conditioner on hallways but every rooms has air conditioner. The one in our room was very noisy, but working. Shower had plenty of hot water. This hotel is right on front of the beach, a fantastic beach!!! When leaving the beach , there is only one shower further down the boardwalk where you can rinse the sand off, so people end up going inside Americana full of sand, carpets and floors are a mess! A simple solution would be for the hotel to have a faucet outside so we can rinse the sand off. The hotel could use some cosmetic renovation in the rooms. Outside by the parking lot there are to large garbage contentors that with the high temperatures release an awful smell.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as what people are saying here.”
Reviews.Author: Kelly A
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last summer. It has a very small indoor pool, but when you have small children it works out just fine. I had no problems with the place being clean. We had clean towels and our room was cleaned every day. If you are a down to earth kind of person and want to stay somewhere cheap, give it a try. It is a GREAT price for the location. Like others have said, you get what you pay for! If you want a nice little trip to the Ocean and you are on a budget, you will not be disappointed. I am surprised to see so many bad reviews! It seems to me people read these reviews and stay at the hotel anyway and just want to complain about what others have said. I plan on staying here again. My kids had a great time and so did we. I don't go to the ocean to stay at the hotel anyway. I just want a clean place to lay my head at night. Good luck in your journey of finding a place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Average clean. Plain n simple.”
Reviews.Author: ocbeachgoer
Reviews.Content: Mid season(july to early aug) the price is too much for what it is. Most of those upset people r just mad because they decided to come to Oc md mid summer on a whim! The staff(who r not professionals but just college students mind u) r kind friendly and do the best they can to solve ne issues that arise. (I noticed a lot of people would get nasty to the staff,which in turn gave them a laugh. These r still kids not trained professionals) I made friends with one of the female desk clerks( an irish girl) and spent alot of time in the lobby chatting while the kids swam/ or got ready from a day at the beach. Our stay in june was so pleasant we came back after main season! The room was spacious and clean both times and we had no problems whatsoever. I will however comment on the "robbery" mentioned below. I was in the lobby when this disgruntled guest came in. The woman ended up telling me that there was an error in the computer and the maids were tasked with cleaning the room as it should b empty. So they must have bagged everything up n placed it downstairs. My only comment about it is that when their items were returned the clerk working asked them THREE TIMES if all there items were present. They said yes everytime. I came to find out they returned hours later claiming items were '"missing". Overall if u need a convenient clean place to sleep with friendly staff. Go here in early or late summer!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: OzziesMom32
Reviews.Content: The price was right and the location was perfect so we picked this hotel. We chose the Americana farthest south in OC, the one without a pool. We could have used the pool at the northern Americana but we never tend to swim in indoor pools and that's all they offer there. The location is perfect, you are walking distance to everything on the Boardwalk and right at the Kite Loft which tends to be an ideal spot for kids. This part of the beach offers playgrounds for the kids every few blocks, we love the FREE fun! The staff was ok, they were exchange students and not really the most helpful, but they were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Morissa2n
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! The pool is awful and we have never used it but for the price I have no complaints. We stayed from Sept. 3-10th, through Labor Day weekend. The hotel is a bit old and getting run down. Some of the furniture is getting shabby and the wallpaper is getting worn. The bedding and drapes need replaced. Some of the sinks have cigarette burns on them...what do you do about THAT? The sliding glass doors are getting moisture in the glass. Although old, the room is always clean. The maids come every day. They clean the sinks, the tub, the toilet, etc. If you want new towels, you leave your used ones on the floor and they replace them. My fiancee and I have stayed here for over 5 years and have never had any major problems. Life is not perfect. Sometimes things go wrong. We have witnessed people screaming at the personnel. The staff always does what they can to handle any situation that may arise. They have had to make us new keys. Is it their fault something happens to the lock? Things break suddenly. People think when something happens they can scream and holler and get their stay refunded. I wish all of life was that way! I know things go wrong where I work and no one intends for bad things to happen. We paid $1200.00 (including tax, etc.) for 7 nights-OCEAN FRONT.

Reviews.Title: “Rotten. Will NEVER stay again.”
Reviews.Author: BadSatin
Reviews.Content: Dear god what a rotten place to stay. Lets start with why we even stayed here. The Hurricane shut OC down for the weekend and our hotel wasn't going to be ready till monday but we wanted to get down on sunday.. needed a place for a night. Called.. said we would have 4 ppl and wanted an ocean front.... $150. ok fine. Get there and the lady informs us it will be an additional $10 a person because we are 4 adults and not 2 adults 2 children and she didn't remember us saying we had 4 on the phone WHICH WE CLEARLY DID... i wanted to argue but i was tired and what was the point? I don't see how that is a difference.. the rooms sleeps 4 people one way or another... so why is is suddenly $20 more because we are all legal?...Either way should've told us ON THE PHONE $170 Pool was NASTY. needed a new liner more than you could imagine.. water obviously not kept very clean... fine.. oh well. Not my biggest complaint... When it comes to the beds and rooms.. thats where i had a problem. Carpet was soaked near the balcony door... oh well hurricane must've gotten it wet.. stuff happens.. I overlooked the pealing wall paper and stains everywhere... its a boardwalk hotel.. then i got into the bed. I think i would've been just as comfortable on a slab of stone with a blanket. Not only was rock hard with springs poking you they had the most awful scratchy sheets on it. Not saying they had bedbugs but SOMETHING was in there biting us. I itched all night and my BF woke up with welts. Springs got me in the back all night to the point where i just gave it up and fought back the tears of exhaustion. The shower was equally as awful. No water pressure so it was hard to get clean.... plus it took decades to even get the water mildly warm. I've stayed at a lot of hotels and i know the quality of the boardwalk ones... they get used alot so you can't expect too much.. but even by those standards.. americana was awful. Save yourself the money and go somewhere nicer. It definitely wasn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: sherrymae
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Americana Hotel. Our room was clean and spacious. Nice view of the ocean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Convenient to the boardwalk. Inexpensive. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An OK experience but would NOT go again.”
Reviews.Author: Sherleyflower
Reviews.Content: What I liked: •it was clean, a good view of the ocean, near the boardwalk and was pretty inexpensive. What I did NOT like: •the people at the main desk did nit help with any of our problems and seemed not to know the area, the pool was filthy and small, our outdoor patio had no chairs to sit on. When ever I go to a hotel I want a nice clean big pool, but no this pool was so small even my 6 year old daughter said it was small. When we wanted to go to a buffet we asked the people at the main desk and they were clueless also when we wanted another roll out bed I asked the front desk and I had to go get it myself and also take it to my room. But I will say that I loved the view and the location. If they would perhaps had a better pool I would give them a much better rating but I will not be staying there anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: william z
Reviews.Content: large room very clean friendly staff not far from stores parking is a little is hard we stayed at the 6th street location i give it a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed by the staff at the Americana.”
Reviews.Author: kateburbs
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid in full for a two night stay at the Americana Hotel on 10th street in OC, MD. After being on the beach during the second day, we turn to the hotel to find all of our belongings gone. I immediately inform the front desk of the situation. The hotel staff act clueless as what to do. Several minutes later, half of our picked through belongings appear at the front desk in trash bags. The staff have no explanation or justification as to where the rest of our belongings we left in the hotel room. The "President of the Hotel" did not care about the inconveniencece or stolen personal belongings. Police report was filed. Lawsuit has to be filed in order for any compensation. I am a fan of cheap hotels but not dishonest ones. Please do not support this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “m u s t s l e e p - and this place did the trick”
Reviews.Author: BarefootBay
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Americana around 3AM, after having been traveling for a good 26 hours from another continent just to get to Ocean City. The hour was of no issue, check-in was fast, considering the season the price was reasonable and the room was very nice, though I wasn't in it for long. Also ok location, not too far from all the goodies by the pier.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for ....”
Reviews.Author: silverh731
Reviews.Content: Come on people, these reviews are a joke! YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!!! Wake up! This hotel is cheap, considering it is ocean front and on 10th Street, it is a great deal. If you want plush, go to the Hilton, WAY up the boardwalk, oh and expect to pay more than triple the price. Pick what you want, this place is run down, its not luxurious, the workers do not speak English very well and on occasion they do have an attitude. BUT, it is clean, it's cheap, its a good location and it is again CHEAP considering its ocean front and on 10th Street. Stop your whining and go to the Hilton if you want luxury. If you want a decent price and decent location, stay here. We stay here every year, can't beat the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT COME HERE PLEASE. TERRIBLE.”
Reviews.Author: pitousee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. I was there during the carbon monoxide incident. Heres what happened; The hotel, which was horribly run (ill get into that later) decided that they didn't need carbon monoxide detectors. I was on the top floor, and the top 3 floors were affected the most. The hotel was evacuated at around 8 in the morning. The police and fire department handled the situation as well as they could. Some of us had to go to the hospital, others were left without their id's, money, or cell phone for hours. The hotel handled this situation terribly. After the evacuation, we were waiting to get our things. This took hours. When we were finally able to get our items, they only gave us 5 minutes to get them. The manager/owner had barricaded themselves in the office and would not speak to anyone. We had to FIGHT to get a refund of our money. This hotel has NO concern about their guests health or well being. When we arrived at the hotel, we were taken back to say the least. There was no air conditioning, flies everywhere, and very very rude staff. The lady at the desk was very unprofessional. There were staff members folding bathroom towels in the lobby and pilling them on the floor, which was covered wet sand and dirt. When we got to our room (which was the penthouse), I was beyond disappointing. The sliding door was COVERED in flies. The "jacuzzi" was nothing more than a bath tub in the middle of a small room, and the shower was completely disgusting. The bed sheets were stained, and the comforter was ripped. The air conditioner was huge and very loud. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Trust me when I tell you that this place was completely horrible. Even for people on a budget, its not worth it. This hotel has no concern for their guests. The place is just unsanitary. It nearly ruined our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location/clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: rmdc29
Reviews.Content: After having problems with a previous hotel booking, my family landed in this hotel which is on 5th street/boardwalk. What a blessing! We booked on the same day and they did not try to raise the price just because it is a last minute booking. We got a room with two queen beds, balcony,fridge and microwave. It was a smoking room but did not smell of smoke at all. It was very clean. However, there was no hair drier and iron. No problem since I always bring my own. The place was very close to the boardwalk with some rooms directly facing the ocean. The only downside that I can say was I kept waking up when the airconditioning unit starts up. It was VERY loud and if you are a light sleeper like me, then you wont have any sleep. It did not bother my hubby and kids who snored through the noise! The parking was a problem,too. The spaces are very tight. My hubby drives a passenger bus so he did not have a problem maneuvering the van through the tight spaces, but any other driver will have a lot of trouble getting in and out of the parking lot. I suggest that once you find a space,DO NOT LEAVE! Overall, it was a nice experience. We will definitely stay here again. For $130/night on a weekend September (SUNFEST), it was not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kristina2781
Reviews.Content: I have a hard time believeing all those awful reviews the staff doesn't speak good english but they are EXTREMELY friendly and helpful the room was clean and roomy and comfortable and I loved staying there and will stay again next year with my children.

Reviews.Title: “Please listen to bad reviews because they are so true!”
Reviews.Author: k_foust
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got there, the girl at the front desk acted stupid. She said she only saw one room under our name when we had three reserved. She also didn't know if our rooms were ready. She told us to go up and check. What hotel does that? So we finally get our room keys after struggling to find a parking spot in their small parking lot. We walk in one room and a guy was sitting on the bed watching tv and smoking a cigarette. He was a worker there. The lock didn't work on that door and the toliet holder was on the floor behind the bathroom door. In the other room there was hair everywhere and it was never cleaned up the whole time I was there. The sliding doors can barely be seen out of because of the nasty scum in between the glass. You can't dial out on their telephone in the rooms period. You can't contact the front desk unless you call the main number from a cell phone. The "penthouse suite" if that's what you wanna consider it, does not have PRIVATE balconies. You cannot have visitors period. We had family members come up from another hotel and we had security knocking on our door with the owner. Then they gave us a list of rules for the place AFTER we got in trouble instead of when we got there.The rules included no alchol if any person under 18 was in the room with you and absolutely no alchol on the balcony. I had a maid sign up for hours the 3rd day I was there and they NEVER cleaned it. Free WiFi? YEAH RIGHT you can't get a connection unless you're sitting in the hallway which is extremely hot. The elevator is so slow and hot too. The AC in the room was horrible. The only clean thing about this place was the shower. The beds only had a sheet and comforter, no blankets. The microwaves, tvs, and phones were all different in every room. The staff takes every thing as a joke and laughs and everything you say. They pretend they can't understand you and you can't understand them. The jacuzzi worked but it's small and very loud. The maids fold sheets and towels up right out in the lobby. There were only three carrying carts for the entire hotel. It took forever for us to even get one to bring our luggage to our room. The indoor pool was very tiny and dirty. I can see why the website has no pictures because the place is gross.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a complete overhaul, inside and out.”
Reviews.Author: ckirk1999
Reviews.Content: Ocean front is the only plus for this hotel. Room was dirty, especially the bathroom. One bed didn't have fitted sheets and the mattress was not the nicest to see, pillows were small and hardly there. Needed lots of maintenance repairs when we checked in. Locks, cleaning, door problems, toilet filthy, needed and got new toilet seat, toilet paper roll missing, a/c, etc. We did get the things fixed but was not expecting to have to go through all of this before we could even get settled. The keys/cards had numerous problems and had to be fixed multiple times. Cannot get refund once you check in, so see your room first. Would not put us in another room. Does not have outside pool and indoor heated pool is in a small area. Location was good, Maria our "maid" was really nice. We felt sorry for her to have to be there. She's better than that place. They can say it's because of kids staying there, etc., but that is not an excuse when you have/own/run a hotel. It is their responsibility to fix things as they happen, not just when someone complains. It appeared some of these problems were there for a period of time. Two people on this trip, over 55, and would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Candle12
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to stay here after reading some of these other reviews. But we had a limited budget and wanted to stay on the boardwalk. This place is great. Friendly staff, great location, elevators, balconies, free internet and an indoor pool. It was great to be right on the board walk. The room was very big, much bigger than i thought. And clean. Never heard loud noises. All in all, I was very pleased in our room for such a low price and will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Ignore the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: AudChop
Reviews.Content: I must say, with all the bad reviews on this place I was a little nervous about it. My husband and I sat for days on end looking at hotels in Ocean City trying to make a decision. Like most we didn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel that we were just going to sleep in, we didn't go on vacation to sit in the hotel room. Finally we came across the Americana, and it had one of the best prices, especially for a hotel right on the boardwalk. Not to Mention the hotel is on 10th street, Which is a greatttt location on the boardwalk, all the shops are around there, anything after 14th street is just hotels and only a handful of shops. We arrived on a Monday at 10am, Check in time isn't until 3pm. But they were nice enough to let us do our paper work in advance so we would be able to park our car in the parking lot before check in (Make sure you do this if you arrive early...they will tow you). The room was ready by 2pm an hour earlier then promised. The rooms are pretty large, we were on the 4th floor with a "side view" you can still clearly see the beach from there. The first thing I did was check for bed bugs, and I was relieved when I came up with nothing. The room was very clean. The maids were great they cleaned the room everyday, we left personal items out in the open with our Cell phones and nothing was touched. The only thing I have to complain about, is the second night were were there there was no hot water when I was trying to give my children a bath, Which I guess is to be expected with such a large hotel. The people were very nice and didn't bother us at all. We came and went as we pleased. They do have an Indoor heated pool, which some other reviews complained about sand being in the bottom. There is sand in the bottom of the pool, but there is really no way to keep the sand out. They do supply a shower in the pool room and there are signs up to please rinse off all sand before going into the pool. The two short times we were in the pool room, we saw many people just jump in with sand all over them. Overall I think this hotel is great for the price and the location couldn't be better, if you have small children its great to not have to cross a road to get to the beach. If your looking for something super fancy then go somewhere else, you get what you pay for. And the Americana is totally worth the money paid. Thank you Americana for a great family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Paid top dollar to stay in a dump.”
Reviews.Author: AverageJoe1234
Reviews.Content: The first room I was given was a Pentouse room on the top floor. The air condition was broke and you could not see through the sliding glass doors on the balcony. So much for ocean view. The glass had a haze in between the glass that was in both rooms I was in. I got a second Penthouse room and noticed many issues. The spigots were leaking, The balcony door would not lock and you had to force it open and closed. The TV was broke and I had to get a new one. I waited almost an hour for them to deliver it. The one dresser drawr fell out and could not be used. All the furniture was old and dusty. The carpet was faded and the wallpaper peeling off the wall. The jacuzi was so noisy you had to yell over the sound of the worn out motor. The jets were not adjustable as the controls were broke. The aircondition was marginal. The coffe pot leaked, there were not pots, pans, dishes, utencils, coffee, filters, nothing. The bathroom had a light bulb missing, there were two broken light switches and a headboard fell off the wall as we were looking for one of the few electrical outlets in the room. i paid $242 a night for this dump. a few items were fixed as i repeatedly complained about them. I did not get a reduced bill for putting up with this below average conditions. Parking was minimal, hotel was dirty, pool was dirty, elevators ran sooo sloooow. i feel I spent half my vacation dealing with problems that should not be there. the people that worked there were Russian and you could hardly understand them.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: Joealton26
Reviews.Content: Me and my family planned a vacation back in Feb. 2010 planned to stay at the Americana Hotel 10th street condo's called and asked for two ocean front condo's everything was tobe so great. When we go their on June 6th 2010 to check in we found the rooms where two blocks away from the board walk our ocean veiw was the veiw of nothen but other hotel buildings, our AC didn't work, I guess the first thing to tell us to get away from this hotel should have been that we were the only people in the whole hotel, Had to walk up to the hotel on the boardwalk to talk to anyone asked to speak to manager but was told he was at the 6th Street hotel so left phone number at desk and ask to be called when he was in and then went to the 6th St. hotel where we was told he was at the 10th st. hotel so left number their also everyday was told the same thing Still havent talked to the manager, when checking out the office was closed was told by workers in parking lot just to stay as long as we wanted no one would care but we wanted to leave and needed our cash deposit back. never got checked out for four hours latter. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: stocker123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Americana at 10th st. for the past 4 yrs. usually after the labor day weekend. Of course this year was out due to there carbon monoxide problem. The staff called us 10 days in advance to let us know the hotel was still shut down they offered us a refund or to move us to there other hotel by the kite loft we decided to give it a try but did not enjoy that stay. that place is really run down even though after 2 days we did get an ocean front room. But after reading some of the bad stories of the Americana at 10th st. I am putting my own thoughts in. Yes the staff is foreign but very easy to understand and very freindly and helpful.. We only stay at the top floor oceanfront jacuzzi rooms so cannot speak for the side rooms. nothing like relaxing in a jacuzzi overlooking the ocean The ac and hot water has always worked in our room.. these rooms were cleaned and linnen changed every day. Yes the furniture and rugs could use an upgrade but then we are not in ocean city to spend every minute in the room. 3 blocks down is a great place to eat phillips by the sea want a few drinks? but don"t want to drive? Hammerheads bar and grill is right below the hotel. Will we stay there again? Yes as soon as there problems are fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have EVER stayed in”
Reviews.Author: fix8her
Reviews.Content: We planned a Thursday to Sunday getaway for "Sunfest" and then a day in AC via the Cape May/Lewes Ferry. We originally booked our stay at the 10th street location. About a week or less before we were scheduled to leave we got a call and was informed that something was wrong with the 10th street location and that we could be refunded our deposit OR stay at their sister location located on 6th and the boardwalk. We opted to stay at the sister location. That was our first mistake. Upon arrival the hotel presents itself a bit tired but ok. We had to pay upfront while facing a sign that said "No refunds". The front desk was occupied by foreigners that my wife couldn't understand. When we got to our room . . . OMG. It was disgusting. It didn't appear that anyone had been staying in the room for quite some time (which probably explains why they could move people from the 10th street location to the 6th street location). The bed linen looked dirty and unchanged (we asked for fresh linen as well as a clean comforter and took care of it ourselves), the bathroom tiles overhead looked ready to fall, the bathroom fan didn't work, tiles on the wall were broken, paint was peeling, furniture was broken and unsteady, the walls in some places had what could have been mold starting, paper peeling . . . . . the list goes on. We decided to tough it knowing most of our days would not be IN the room. Ocean City, MD is getting old . . . go somewhere fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: dave542
Reviews.Content: Made plans with this hotel for a bike week trip.Payed for my room in advance.Back in Feb. 1 day before our trip we were told by the hotel thay they had a carbon monoxide INCIDENT and were closed. And had been since mid Aug.Was told it would take 7 to 10 days to give me my refund Had to come up with money for 2nd hotel out of my pocket. When i ask the americana about maybe a free knight or something at a later date. I was told they had already lost because of this. And i was on my own Thanks to the Park place hotel for helping with such short notice. Dave Hagerstown Md

Reviews.Title: “stressfull and aggravating”
Reviews.Author: AMERICANJEWL09
Reviews.Content: Sept.3,09 after driving 4 hours with daughter and my 6 month old grandson was looking forward to arriving at our motel unload get cleaned up and relax. but instead we arrived to find out motel had been shut down due to a carbon monoxide leak. girl behind desk who was not professional at all said motel has been closed we called to let you know, i never received any calls on home phone or my cell. needless to say we made our reservations on Aug.16,09 and this accident happened on Aug.14,09 wonder why we wasn't told of the accident before hand???? very stressfull trying to find a room being holiday weekend everything was prettymuch booked . we had to stay block back from boardwalk . girl behind desk and another lady were sitting their watching tv. they were no help in assisting us on finding other accomadations. they do have 3 or 4 sister motels be sure to find out who runs motels before staying think they were very unprofessional,shady about this accident.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: beachlover274
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitent to stay here after reading the horrible reviews this place has received, but for the price and availability I had not choice. My family and I stayed in the Americana's Condo located on 10th Street for OC's Bike Week and they were awesome. They were very spacious, clean, easy access and had a nice floor plan. I would stay here again with no hesitation. My only very minor complaint was that there was no wi-fi service and the furniture in the living room was not the most comfortable. The couch had a pull-out bed that was not very sleep friendly. Other than that, the place was fine. Haven't stayed in one of the regular rooms yet but have one booked for Sept 2009 (Ocean Front) so we will see how that goes.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare in disguise”
Reviews.Author: ceckenro
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 2 friends for 2 nights which was definitely all that we could take. Not only was it not as nice as advertised, you pay for ice, the pool was horrible and our steet view, overlooked teh trashcans one floor down from us leaving us with a nice odor to come back to the room and relax too. On top of everything, the day of checkout, the hotel was closed indefinitely due to a carbon monoxide leak and we couldnt leave for 3 hours after check out making us miss our night jobs back at home. Budget friendly is not always the best way to go. The location was great and the AC and hot water worked but the feeling the hotel gave was not safe, specifically teh elevators which everyone has to take because the stairwell has "Alarm" signs saying it will go off if you use them. PS those stair signs lie. Feel free to use the stairs. Its just cheaper for them to put up a sign that says do not use because of alarm than to actually install one.

Reviews.Title: “could have killed me”
Reviews.Author: ricky5564
Reviews.Content: ok.. so me and my family went to this hotel... it of coarse was horrible... we reserved 2 rooms... we only got one and it was smoking!... and it took 1 day to get the real rooms.... so... we have our rooms... we unpack...and go to bed........ we wake up to FIRE ALARMS! It SUCKED!.... apparently.. it was not a drill... it was a CO leak ... the fire department came... ambulance, cops, U NAME IT! and it was there.... this hotel had no service, the pool was small and creepy, and kind of green, the elevators took FOR EVER TO OPEN! (i say this because i HATE elevators) and the rooms aren't well maintained..... over all... if you love your family DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Just when you think it can't get any worse, Americana steps it up!!!”
Reviews.Author: cbittin2
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the amercana hotel on 10th street expecting a lovely hotel with a large indoor heated pool, as seen in the internet pictures. We got our key and headed to our room and found only one bed...for 4 people? We returned to the front desk and they referred us to their other hotel 4 streets down on 6th street because they didnt have any rooms to fit us. (note: we called ahead and made reservations 3 weeks ahead of time). We had already paid in advance so we had to listen to them. We walked to 6th street only to find that the rollaway bed we paid $10 a night for didn't seem to exist. So we were forced to stay in a room with only 2 beds. We also had to walk back to 10th street to get our refund for the cot because the 'o so lovely" assistant at 6th street wouldn't give us a refund. We didn't even get the indoor pool because it is in another hotel 3 streets up. It is very small and the bottom is coated in sand. The pool, aswell as the hotel, has extremely poor upkeep, and alot of false advertisement. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME...OR MONEY HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: BertBalto
Reviews.Content: Things you might expect when paying peak rates that you might not get here: 1. Clean furniture in the room and on the balcony 2. Help with luggage 3. Free ice, newspaper, coffee in room 4. A restaurant that actually does serve breakfast as advertised 5. Dishes, flatware, glasses in the "kitchen" 6. More than one washcloth 7. An iron 8. A reason to come back Other notes on our room - no door on the freezer in the mini refrigerator, cracked toilet seat, very flat pillows, dirty coffee pot upon arrival (although the housekeeping staff was very nice and responsive). Good thing: great view

Reviews.Title: “Better than what the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: lmhs94
Reviews.Content: After trusting my friends word that the hotel was okay despite reading the reviews i booked a side view room for 99 dollars a night. When we arrived at 2pm we asked if we could check in early and was allowed. We had come with another family but they had a different room. My two kids and I had a room on the 5th floor and it was room number 513. It had a great view for being sideview. Our maid would do anything we asked her to. Although she never cleaned the balcony window like we asked. It was pretty clean, quiet, and nice. Our air conditioner had its wires crossed we found out after telling the desk it wouldnt work. Overall we liked the americana hotel and plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “RIP Offs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sassy09Maryland
Reviews.Content: IWe had a game down at the ocean so we decided to stay at the cheap "ok" hotel. Upon checking in we were asked to pay in advance for our weekend stay. Fine. BUT on sunday when we were checkinhg out we could not because we paid until monday??????? Our game was finished we did not make the playoffs. Susan was not helpful all she had to say is I'll take you room key if your leaveing!! WTF! Why would anyone pay 131.50 just to pay it?

Reviews.Title: “How is this place even still in business?!”
Reviews.Author: Blitzburghpa
Reviews.Content: On April 4th 2009 me and a friend came down to stay for a couple nights because we had interviews down there. That night a big cockroach came fleeing from the bathroom and also had them on our balcony. We killed it and then went down to the front desk to ask for our money back. The lady at the front desk was so unprofessional and not well mannered at all! She rolled her eyes when we explained we had a bug situation and told us were not allowed to use the stairs. We told her we never even used the stairs and she just kept repeating herself raising her voice at us. We told her we wanted to talk to a manager so she calls up the manager and he didn't even have the decadency to speak to myself or my friend. He said to the front desk clerk to switch us rooms and we told her that we already didn't want to even do that just the fact that if there were cockroaches in that room they are going to be everywhere else. They said sorry too bad your not getting your money back. We decided to switch room. A neighbor came out and asked if we had cockroaches all over our room too and we told her yes. She said she complained and didn't even offer her another room. We switch to a different room we look all around did not see any. Next morning wake up there were 3 of them in the room by the kitchenet. NEVER NEVER NEVER AGAIN WOULD I STAY THERE! THE STAFF IS VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: NeseeDCoy
Reviews.Content: We had a decent experience here. We were terrified of what we might find, after reading the reviews. We had a smoking room on the 2nd floor, oceanfront. It did not smell of smoke, and the room was clean. The furniture could use a little updating, but I'm not at the beach to sit and look at the furniture. The bathroom was clean, and water pressure was very good, with hot water never being a problem. The only complaint I would have, and it's not really a complaint, just more of an observation - but the girls that worked at the front desk would be folding sheets/towels on their downtime. Thought that was a bit strange. The hallway by the elevator room always smelled like something was burning, but it was only for the few seconds when you walked by. I would give this hotel a chance. We've stayed at nicer places in OC, but also spent $200 MORE per night, for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: iamkarkar
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that I didnt read these reviews before I checked into the hotel or I would have been scared away. Although not the nicest hotel it is far from awful. Hotels in ocean city are very overpriced, and I was able to stay here 3 nights for what would have cost me 2 nights at many other hotels. There were a few minor problems with the hotel room, but they were minor. My only complaint was the walls were paper thin and the kids next door woke me up, but that would pretty much happen anywhere. If you believe that a hotel room is just a place to keep your stuff and sleep, and you like to actually spend your vacation outside of the hotel than this hotel is perfect. The rooms were clean, I had a side view of the ocean and the bay. Overall great stay. Don't be scared away by all the bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “L-O-V-E-D the condos”
Reviews.Author: Brendaluvsgarth
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I met my sister and her 3 children and her in laws and their daughter in the 3 bedroom condo for a 3 night stay. (did you follow all of that??)It was AWESOME!!! I read prior reviews and was slightly worried. I shouldnt have been. Manuela at the front desk was awesome and we even left her a gift basket. We were able to check in early and on check out day we were able to leave our luggage with them while we took one last walk on the boards. The view of the beach was amazing. So convenient just 1/2 block walk to the boards. LOVED having a washer and dryer to use every day. We wished the pool was on 6th and not 10th, but the ocean was a breath away.The condo was clean, large and better than expected. A window needed repair and the balcony door needed effort to lock, but it was a great stay and we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet vacation”
Reviews.Author: silkcat13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed several times at the Americana Motel on 10th street. Never did we have a problem with this motel. After reading all the bad reviews this year I had to wonder if something had changed; and if I should change our reservations. We decided not to change them and found the motel to be clean, no problems with water or air conditioning; The location is perfect. My advise is give it a try. We stayed in room 606 it has a perfect view of North Ocean City and a georgeous Ocean front balcony view of boardwalk and ocean. Only problem was elevators are not airconditioned, but that was a minor one. Hammerheads which is the bar and grill on the first floor boardwalk side, has best burgers and wings in Ocean City. The Nelsons

Reviews.Title: “Americana aka Migrane Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobsnafu
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to develop a migrane headache I have the sure fire way of doing so. Book your stay at the Americana Hotel in Ocean City, Maryland. Here is a partial list of contributing factors to the migrane. 1) No hot water for close to 2 days. My stay was from an arrival on Thursday to a departure on Sunday The 'no hot water' occured on Saturday and continued on Sunday. 2) No AC with the exception of opening the screen less balcony door and allowing, thakn goodness, a cool ocean breeze to make things somewhat comfortable. 3) Wallpaper that lack an adhesive backing meaning = peeling away from the walls. 4) a wood slate between the matress and boxspring of one bed. I guess this is their interpretation of a sturdy comfortable bed. 5) Two plastic chairs on the balcony that the last time they saw their original white color was when they were purchased. Please, at least spend 9.99 for a new plastic chair. 6) Cockroaches in the hallway/ stairwells 7) Not witnessed by myself hoiwever said bug in my friends room. 8)An oily smell that seemed to eminate from the downstairs lobby. I could go on however I am starting to develop a migrane just reliving these experiences from my writings.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price! Don't listen to other reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Nirvana123085
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Americana over President's Day weekend. Before leaving for the beach, I read the other reviews on this site. Needless to say I was a little scared of what I might have gotten myself in to. Upon arrival I was pleased with my decision to stay here. We stayed in Suite 711. The room was excellent and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would highly reccomend to anyone who wants to stay oceanfront! I am not sure why others talked so badly about this hotel. I had a chance to see one of the regular rooms and they were clean as well. The only conclusion I can come to is the other people who left reviews were expecting this hotel to be the Waldorf Astoria or a Hilton or somthing like that. It is a great hotel and I highly reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “dirty halls, dirty rooms & a staff that doesn't care”
Reviews.Author: Dismiss
Reviews.Content: I wish I had seen these reviews before. Do not stay here. Key cards did not work, toilet backed up, air conditioner would not cool room, no hot water in the mornings, looked liked someone throwup on the hallway wall beside elevator and no one cleaned it our entire 3 day stay. Remote for tv would not work. Out of the three chairs in the room two had so many stains neither my wife our I would use them. The elevator had trash on top of the light grills the entire time. Eveything was dirty and dusty. Great location but not much else. Stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “The Devil himself would run from this hell hole”
Reviews.Author: cmgricks
Reviews.Content: No running water half of the time. Pool was broken. Linens were not changed. Doors were dirty. Sliding glass door was almost unopenable. TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare stay with no recourse”
Reviews.Author: mrdchiggins
Reviews.Content: The experience of staying at this hotel was the one of the worst I've ever had. This place was filthy, smelled terrible, and the service was a joke. We had a sick, noisy, crying baby next door to us. Now nobody can blame a baby for being sick right? We were woken up at 1100PM, 1200AM, 100AM, 200AM,.When asked to move to a different room we were told that we had to move our luggage out by 1100am. No problem. Next we were woken by F-YOU, F-YOU, F-YOU, F-YOU and alot of other foul words that even my 9 year old couldnt take. We asked to be moved again and were told by the desk to stay in our room. The desk person didnt understand that we were in our room and thought that we were in the hall having a altercation with the cussers. We tried to explain to her that we were woken up again througe the walls and would like another room. She told us that she had moved us once and would not move us again. Man was I ticked. Next morning I tried to contact the manager but he took 2 days to contact me. When asked for a refund for the room that we certainly didnt get more than 2 hours of sleep in, we were told that a refund was out of the question. RUN BY THIS HOTEL....DONT STAY HERE.... This was typical of my stay and I would not recommend staying here even as a last resorttttt.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel i ever stayed in!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aulnkel7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Ocean City MD. We stayed at the Americana Hotel on 10th. St. it was the worst hotel we ever stayed in. When we got to the room none of the lights would go on i had to find the plugs to plug them in. The microwave did not work the shower knob was broken and the water poured out like a jet. There was no remote for the tv. Our balcony was above the garbage so every night at 2:30 we would be woken up to bottles being dumped in the cans and not to mention the smell. When we were in the elevator it stopped and the alarm went off. We will not be returning to this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Run From This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn M
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be one of the most gross hotels I have ever stayed at. First the lock on the door was broken, they told me that someone would be up to fix it the next morning -- I dont think so I had a two year old with me that knows how to open doors. Our light when you first come in was also blown out. The sheets on the bed were stained, the toliet never looked like it was ever cleaned, the floors turned your socks black, the hotel stunk and the tvs have no remote controls. We paid 345.00 a night to stay in what they call the penthouse. the pent house consists of a jacuzzi tub that i would not give my dog a bath in. this was the most distgushing place I have ever been to. My son feel out of the bed, and the next day when we got home, he has a rash on his cheek, i know it was from this gross hotel. The hotel refused t give us our money back. what ever you do, if this is the last hotel in ocean city, sleep in your car, this is the worse hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay At The Condos - It's GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Questans
Reviews.Content: My wife and our extended family stayed at the Americana Hotel - Condos - located on 6th street and found it to be a very satisfactory hotel despite some of the negative reviews. The condos is relatively new. We were told that it was built in 2005. We believed it. The three bedroom condos was clean, spacious, and reasonably priced. The condo is one block away from the boardwall too - which is nice. The staff members are exceptionally friendly and made both the check in and check out processes easy and quick. They even gave us an extra parking permit because we had multiple cars that need to be parked. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel-condo and wouldn't hesitate recommending it to others. Just be sure to ask for a condo.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyB
Reviews.Content: There is nothing American about this place they don't speak english very well I did have a reservation here but had to cancel because I had a death in my family but they did not understand they still charged my card which I thought was really outrageous. They are apparently located on top of a restaurant which is really noisy. The lady I talked with to make the reservatin kept asking me if I was over 25 I told her that I was. THIS PLACE HAS NO RESPECT OR CLASS. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “I made a mistake choosing this one”
Reviews.Author: va-easydoesit
Reviews.Content: The curtains and bedspreads smelled so bad I had to check out early. because I knew they could not make it right, and they knew too, that's the problem with this hotel, it needs a total renovation. I learned a good lesson for my next trip, visit the hotel and see the room first, or check out trip advisor, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: mskitty44
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at Ocean City on a whim. It was my boyfriends birthday........and so we just went down there for the day. We stayed at the Tidelands.......this place was wonderful. We got a two room suite for friday. On saturday, we decided to stay another night, but Tidelands didn't have any open rooms, so we tried the Americana. When I walked in, I had a bad feeling about the place. The ceilings were about 7 ft high and didn't look like the cleanest place. But we went with it anyway. The person at the front desk was not very friendly and acted like we interrupted her when we got to the counter. Not only that but we paid the same amount that we spent at the Tidelands for friday. Let me tell you.......What a disappointment!! The room was horrible and smelled really bad. We soon found out why.....when we opened the sliding door, we found we were right above the dumpsters. yummy. It started to rain, so we spent much time in the room trying to watch tv. But it was a tiny tv, so we had to be all up on the tv just to see what was on. The ceiling was black right above the bed where the vent was. I didn't feel very clean staying there and was very disappointed. Don't make the same mistake we did. Stay at the tidelands. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Morrisun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Americana Hotel's 2 bedroom condos. After reading the reviews of the Americana Hotel itself, I was a little bit leary of what we would find upon arrival. However, once we arrived I was very pleasantly surprised. The Condo was a block from the ocean/boardwalk, right across the street from the Americana Hotel. We were on the top floor and from our balcony we could easily see and hear the ocean. The condo was HUGE! It had 2 bedrooms one with a king size bed, the other with 2 Queens, and 2 bathrooms. The one bathroom had a shower/tub combo and the other bath had a whirlpool tub and stand alone shower. It also had a full-size kitchen, dining table, TV with DVD, and a sofabed and loveseat along with end tables and a coffee table. On top of all that, it also had a full size washer and dryer. All in all, it was an excellent experience, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We should have slept in our car!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl2958
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Ocean City yesterday. We decided to go down on a whim to see the beach one last time before winter. We were looking for something close to the boardwalk, also with an indoor pool. We thought we had found that with the Americana. Boy, were we wrong!!! We got there in the afternoon and just dropped our bags off in the doorway. At that time, the room had a "closed-up" smell. We didn't think too much of it at the time---that was our first mistake. We returned to our room about 4 hours later to check out the indoor pool. It was very small, which was okay (so it shouldn't be much to clean, right???) When we looked into the pool at the lights, you could see scum floating on the top of the water. It looked like it had an oily residue floating, but the scum looked like dead skin, like someone had sunburn and peeled. Yuck!!! I'm getting shivers just thinking about it. We said something to the girl at the front desk, and she looked at us like she didn't hear or understand us. At that time, we went back to room, and tried to turn on the air conditioner. That and the TV did not work. We still thought the room smelled a little musty. We thought it just needed the air on. They did send someone up right away, to fix these things. So, we left and went back out for the evening. When we returned from the boardwalk after midnight, the stench of the room knocked us over! We thought it was coming from the air conditioner, but wasn't sure. It did get more humid out as the evening went on, so this must have brought on the smell. My fiance went down to the front desk to say something, and the first thing he was told was, "you should have said something right away", and that there is nothing they could do about it now. He said we would have to take it up with the manager in the morning, that he could not do anything about a refund. (Plus, he told my fiance the room we were in went for $79 a night, but since it was Sunfest Weekend we were charged $139.) We knew we wouldn't get another room that late in the night, so he asked for some air freshener or something. They did provide that, which helped a little. The beds seemed to have clean sheets and the towels were clean. That and the view are about the only nice thing to say. We had the same problems with the sliding door and the elevators, as did other people who reviewed here. In the morning, we asked to speak to the manager, and again we got a blank stare. We asked again, and got a curt "manager is not here". We know we will never get refunded, but I just hope this will help someone else not to make the same mistake we made. I have learned a valuable lesson------read reviews before setting out!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Decent”
Reviews.Author: MomSavedbyGrace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to get away for two nights at Ocean City, Maryland. We drove down not knowing where we were gonna stay, but we wanted to stay on or close to the boardwalk and we also had a budget of no more than $125 per night for a room. After 10-12 tries at various places (hotel was booked, too expensive, inexpensive but gross, etc.) we ended up at the Americana Motor Inn on 6th street, 1/2 block off the boardwalk, for $99 a night. For being slightly more upscale than a motel, we were pleasantly surprised with many things. The staff, though foreign, were very friendly and pleasant. The room was clean, and quiet........we were on the 4th floor which was the highest one, I would recommend doing that to eliminate noise from above. It came with a little kitchinette of which we didnt use except for the little refrigerator. We had a view of the ocean from our balcony, which was really nice. It was so close to the boardwalk and the beach, which was very convenient. The daily maid service was great! This isn't the Hilton by any means, but if you need a decent, clean place to stay on a budget, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I read these reviews first.....run away from the Americana!”
Reviews.Author: geneticblend
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room for THREE PEOPLE at the Americana. When we got to the room, there was only ONE BED! We returned to the desk and said that there must be some mistake, because we reserved a room with two beds. We were told that there was no mistake. We asked if we could have another room, and we were told no, that they were completely full. They said that they could provide us with a roll-away cot. We left the hotel, and tried to find something else, but all of the places on the beach/boardwalk had "NO VACANCY" signs. So we felt forced to return to the Americana. Looking back, I think I rather would have drove the 7 hours back home. They brought us a cot right away with the sheets all tied down to it with a dirty strap. The room was full of stains. There were stains on the carpet, stains on the ceiling, stains on the seats of the chairs, and even stains on the lamp shades! The dining table had a leg broken off of it, and the leg was taped and glued back together. The patio's cement floor was stained too! And the patio chairs were those cheap plastic white ones. The patio chairs were dirty. Our view from the balcony was of an alleyway with a dumpster. Garbage was all over the alleyway. We also had a view of a roof of the building next door. It was full of sea gull droppings. Yuck! The room was also a smoking room, when we had requested non-smoking. When we went to leave the room to head to dinner, our hotel room door would not lock. We had to have maintenance come to completely remove the locking mechanism. We waited around for about 1 hour for them to do this. Then we finally left for dinner--at first making sure that our door would lock! The elevator was SLOW, and always crowded. It would start with a jerk. The hallway carpet was in some spots covered with sand. When we returned to the room to sleep for the night, we had to make up the extra cot ourselves. Trying to sleep was impossible! The air conditioner made such loud noises! We tried to turn it down--but the noises still persisted. We tried to turn it off, but the on/off switch would not work. My husband called the front desk, but there was no answer. I left the room to go sleep in our car! And while I was outside, I noticed that the Americana had a sign that indicated "Vacancy"! When we tried to switch our room, we were told that they were full! Finally, at 2:30 am we had someone come to the room to shut off the air conditioner so that we could get some sleep! Sleeping in the heat was more relaxing than sleeping with a loud air conditioner! Some of the other reviews mentioned that the employees of the hotel spoke with accents. We found that to be true also. It seemed as if some of them only knew limited English. We paid $125.00 for this disgusting room. I just wish I would have read some of these reviews before staying there. A sign directly behind the check in counter reads, "No Refunds". BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Give me a hurl bucket.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a crap hole. The rates for off season were ok, the location was great, but thats it. The heater was either full bore hot or nothing, the slider door was not locking, the room stunk. There was no coffeee pot, nor alarm clock. No dishes or silverware. Its a bad hotel and they are all Russians, or something like that. DO NOT STAY THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't throw your money down the drain!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The BEST thing I can say about this hotel is the location. It is located on 6th Street and the boardwalk. The rates were reasonable for July (prime season) but upon entering the room it seemed ok until we started to settle in....."fresh stains" on the bedspreads....off they came, food crumbs under the beds, dirty kitchen sink,......you get the picture. Once I gave the bathroom and kitchen a cleaning I felt a little (not much) more comfortable about my children being in here. It was late upon check in so moving was out of the question and most of the hotels were booked, so we tried to make the best of it. Now for the outside.....our view was a side oceanview, now that was great (but the dirty drapes would gross you out to pull them out of the way to go out on the balcony) but directly across the street seasonal rental to teens who cussed and drank and stayed up all hours. The hotel is connected to a Italian Restaurant, which you would think wouldn't be so bad....wrong. All of the trash from this restaurant was dragged down the hallway outside of the rooms leaving a stinky wet trail behind. I don't think they have ever powerwashed the concrete or stairs to get rid of the stinky, dirty, trashy grime from the leaking trash cans. This Oceanfront building was one of two, the building behind this one had an elevator, this one did not so you had to walk up and down the stairs. I have lived in Maryland all my life and have vacationed in Ocean City every summer since I was 12 and this is one of the worst I have seen. This could be a nice hotel if someone would just gut the rooms and remodel. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe We Stayed Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Ocean City for a two night stay on Thursday and Friday. After a 7 hour drive we were tired and my wife went in to the Americana to check on a room. I should have went in myself, or at least with her, but since I drove the whole way I just waited in the car in the alley next to the lobby. She paid in advance for 2 nights at an unbelievable rate of $200 for Thursday night and $240 for Friday night!!!! I honestly think they took advantage of her. Of course the paperwork was clear - no refunds after checking in. So we were out the money regardless, might as well try to make the best of it. The location of the hotel on the Boardwalk ant 10th street was nice, but it all went downhill from there. The elevators scare you to death, and I got the same reaction from everyone we rode with during our entire stay! I've never been on an elevator that jumped like those did, and after they stopped you wondered if the door was ever going to open. The indoor pool is a joke. I've been in hot tubs that were almost as large. The mattresses kept sliding off of the beds. Our sliding door took both of us to open and close. The furniture on the deck was filthy and cheap. The AC was a joke. It was either too cold or too hot. It had only one vent and it was high up on the wall and blew straight down on the beds. There was no way around it. If you wanted to sleep with the AC on you had to put up with the wind, not to mention the noise. The bathroom was dirty looking, and the shower curtain had mildew all over it. The toilet rocked on the floor, probably leaked on the room below us. I tried to find a USA Today and was informed that the closest place to get one was 5 blocks away. We tried to call a marina to check on renting a wave runner and was told it was a long distance call. The marina was only 12 blocks away!!!! Needless to say, we will never stay here again. For $240 I deserve to be pampered, not annoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was good size but that was the end of the compliments. The help does not speak English especially when there is a problem. We did not have good maid service as they did not show up for 2 days and we had to ask for more towels for which we got attitude. The room was not clean as I never took off my shoes or socks. There were stains on the ceiling, broken tiles in the entry way, dirt in the bathroom corners, the towel bar fell off in the bathroom, the mirror lights did not all work and the air conditioner gave off a smell of stinky feet if not on high all of the time. The indoor pool looked like it was growing algae and the hallways were sand covered and extremely hot in temperature. The only way to travel in the hotel is in two really old and unstable elevators. We were never sure if we were going to make it to our room or not. The stairs are all blocked off to be used for emergency only. There are no carts to help get your luggage in and there are three steps up in the entry way door. The room has no alarm clock and the phone shows no way to call the front desk or how to call out. The patio has no screen door and I refused to sit on the dirty plastic chairs they provided. I would never stay here again and would not recommend any one else to stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Reviews Very True”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a previous review for Feb 2005 there were problems mentioned that were also very true for our trip. The cleanliness of the room was just ok. I was afraid to use the bedspread, I put it aside. There was a urine smell in the bathroom, we had a bad recepticle in the bathroom that I reported our first day there and it wasn't fixed. What's the deal with the coffee pot anyway? No filters, or coffee kits. No soap for the sink, or any other kitchen items. I asked for coffee and they gave me a lousy attitude. It's true there's no clock or alarm clock. The response you'll get is there is a microwave. They do have foreigners working there except for a few and you get stares and an attitude from most of them. There was one younger girl that I give some credit for being nice and even working there! I honestly felt after our stay that even the fair rate this hotel had was a rip off. Oceanfront or not, you still need a clean, usable room and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a whim, my family decided to do a day trip to OC. It had been a very long time since my wife and I had been to OC and never had my children traveled there. I did an internet search and booked the Americana for two nights since the off season rate seemed reasonable, location (oceanfront-10th street and boardwalk) was close to the action etc.. The day after I booked the Americana, this TripAdvisor hit me with some pretty bad reviews. Images of the aftermath of spring break teens, smoked filled rooms and all gave some concern. Actually, if you read some of the other reviews you'd think the health department...well, let me clear things up for you. The people at the front desk are very friendly. The lobby, pool room, hallways were not smoked filled. I would recommend a makeover in terms of paint/wallpaper, but all in all our first impression was good. Our room was on the Penthouse level which included a 2 1/2 person jacuzzi tub. Everything was operational and the room included a kitchenette with a refrigerator and microwave that were invaluable for heating up leftovers etc. Not the Taj Mahal, but well run and clean. The best thing about the Americana is the location, close to some good restaurants/shops and the pier. My family had a nice stay at The Americana. If you are on a budget and location is important to you, I would stay at The Americana.

Reviews.Title: “The Bad Reviews are True!!!!! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: AVOID! AVOID! AVOID! My boyfriend and I read the bad reviews before we stayed in the Americana hotel, but we thought we would give it a try anyway since the price was right and we had already made reservations (by the way you have to cancel 10 DAYS IN ADVANCE)!!! We stayed there the 18th and 19th of February, and we would not stay there again. No matter where you went in the hotel there was a HORRIBLE smoke smell. We asked for a non-smoking room, but there were 2 ashtrays in the room. Both nights, the receptionist as well as other guests were smoking throughout the lobby. My boyfriend had to go to the bathroom when we got there, but we ended up having to clean the bathroom first. There were NASTY urine stains ALL OVER the toilet and all over the toilet seat, and the whole bathroom was very gross....it didn't look like it had been cleaned properly in quite a while. We ended up having to buy sanitizing wipes so that we could disinfect the entire room before we were able to use it. The floors had not been vacuumed, and they were not cleaned the second day either...so we felt the need to wear our shoes and socks the whole time. There were stains throughout the room...even the ceiling. The room did not have an alarm clock (which I have NEVER experienced before), so we never knew what time it was. There was a coffee maker, but there was no coffee or filters....what good is that??? There were two of us staying in the room, and we only received one washcloth and one towel.....NO BATH MAT!!!!!!! As mentioned in other reviews, the sliding glass door was very difficult to open and close, and we could hear the other guests opening and slamming theirs as well. We didn't even attempt to use the pool...we were tooooooo afraid. As we rode the EXTREMELY slow elevator down on check-out morning with two other couples, the mood was anything but happy and friendly. These two couples seemed as annoyed and disappointed as we were. The only good thing about the hotel was the view outside and the location. My family, as well as my boyfriend’s family, has been staying in Ocean City for over 30 years. Rumor in ocean city is that the hotels along the boardwalk are inadequate because of the high school and college kids who come and stay in cheap places to get drunk. This is the main reason why we have avoided staying in no name hotels and motels. The Americana Hotel is a prime example of the unacceptable conditions that plague hotels along the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “a disaster”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel many times and while it it not the best it was always adequate until my last trip on oct. 27th 2004. we had a smoke free room but when we entered the smell of smoke was terrible. the balcony was filthy and there was a plastic cup will with wet cigerette butts. half the lights did not work and the room was quite dirty. when we complained, we were shown another room. this one was worse than ours. all in all we looked at 7 rooms. one had mold two feet high on the bathroom wall. in another room when my wife turned on the light the bulb exploded and we had to bring her to the emergency room. when we got back at 1;30 in the morning we demanded out money back (they did give us the money) and we went next door to the paridise hotel which was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Really a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to read some of the negative reviews of the Americana. I'll grant you that the hotel is not the Taj Mahal, but it was a pretty good place for the in season side view room we had on the sixth floor. The room we stayed in was clean, and the maids were very friendly and kept things in order while we wree there. The bathrooms were not spotless, but I've seen worse in places where I had paid more. The indoor pool is small, but it served our children well during one rainy day we had. The place was very quiet. We never heard noise from other guests, and being on the sixth floor, we heard no street noise. The balcony will seat about four adults. The chairs were not very clean on the balcony, and on the sixth floor, the balconies were not covered. The elevators were slow, and the hotel offers no assistance in transporting luggage from the lobby to your room. There are carts available to take it up, and there appeared to be plenty of parking for guests. We got a spot very close to the door and had a spot during our entire stay. The staff was mostly foreign, but you come to expect this in Ocean City, Md. Nearly every store or restaurant is either managed by foreign residents or has foreign people working there. I have absolutely no problem with this. The workers were very friendly at all times and were quite helpful whenever we had a question or need. If you're looking for a cheap place to stay in Ocean City in a good central boardwalk location with very nice ocean views, then consider the Americana. It's not the vacation hotel of your dreams, but if you want a good low budget option, I'd say go for it. We're planning to go to Ocean City, MD, again next year, and will consider the Americana again.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING- DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is owned/operated by foriegners who speak broken english (their english gets worse when there is a problem). Our hot water was out at different times three of our four days there (try waiting hours to get ready for dinner). One day we had no water at all! The elevator broke and stayed that way for at least two days (when we checked out it was still broke). We carrried all of our luggage (and 17 month old) six floors up and down. The patio furniture was covered in a thick layer of dirt and was unuseable. The microwave was broke and the buttons on the old phone stuck. They advertise cribs as being available. When we requested one, they tried to tell us there were none. After complaining, it took several hours to assemble one from storage. Then they attempted to charge us $10 a day rent for it! The management makes no apologies and certainly does not give refunds or try to make things right. If this all sounds good to you then risk your vacation on this dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good deal and a good t ime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the americana at a time when they were offering a special promotion. We found them friendly well cleaned a good deal for the money.
